RT @NZNationalParty: Under National Kiwis are receiving better, faster cancer treatment and more support during their care. https://t.co/1x…
Cancer disease, unfortunately, is one of the most important health problems of our day, affecting more and more people every day.
While 175 thousand people are diagnosed with cancer each year in our country, nearly 10 million people worldwide lose their lives because of cancer.
Cancer caused by 90 percent of external factors is never treatable. We have to defeat the cancer.
We can protect our health by reducing harmful habits such as tobacco, alcohol and inactivity, and reduce the risk of cancer.
Also, as in all diseases, we must not forget that the most important factor in successful fighting with cancer is early diagnosis.
We should cooperate with the Ministry of Health and other institutions to raise awareness about early diagnosis.
4 February I wish that the World Cancer Day will contribute to the increased awareness of this disease. RTA
I wish all of our patients, especially the ones who have cancer treatment, to receive urgent healing from God. RTA
